conversation.text: Hello, today we are making coconut milk tapioca
Sounds good to me!
The first step is to soak the tapioca in coconut milk.
evidence: Soak the tapioca in the coconut milk.

conversation.text: The whole tapioca?
We will use the small pearl tapioca. Stir 1/3 cup of that in 2 and 2/3 cups of coconut milk into medium saucepan. Let it sit for 30 minutes.
evidence: Stir in ⅓ cup (50 g) of small pearl tapioca and let it rest for 30 minutes

conversation.text: Oh that makes sense!
The tapioca should absorb some of the coconut milk. Is it starting to soften a little?
evidence: tapioca should absorb some of the coconut milk and soften a little.

conversation.text: No. Should I heat the milk?
Not yet. Make sure the tapioca has started softening before moving on.
evidence: apioca should absorb some of the coconut milk and soften a little

conversation.text: After waiting for a few minutes, it's ready now.
Great! Next, you will need to stir in 1/3 cup of granulated sugar and 1/4 teaspoon of salt into the saucepan. Stir until it is combined.
evidence: Stir in the sugar and salt.
Pour ⅓ cup (65 g) of granulated sugar and ¼ teaspoon (1 g) of salt into the saucepan.

conversation.text: Sure, they have dissolved.
Next, you will cook the pudding on the stove. Turn heat to medium and cook until pudding begins to bubble gently. Make sure to stir so it doesn't scorch.
evidence: Stir and cook the pudding until it simmers
Turn the heat to medium and cook the pudding until it begins to bubble gently.

conversation.text: Sorry, what is pudding here?
"Pudding" just refers to the mixture currently in your saucepan.
I see. I am still stirring the mixture. Can you show me what to do next in advance?
Yes. It may take about 10 minutes for it to start bubbling. After that, reduce the heat to low and cook for 15 minutes, stirring constantly.
Just set a timer. What's after the 15-minute cooking?
When the pudding thickens and tapioca pearls turn clear, turn off the heat and stir in 1/2 teaspoon of pure vanilla extract.
evidence: t should thicken and the tapioca pearls should turn clear.
Turn off the heat and stir in the vanilla

conversation.text: I will.
How is the pudding looking?
It's getting thicker, and there are some clumps in the bottom of the pan.
Make sure to stir the pudding constantly while it cooks.
Sure. Do I need to scrape out those clumps?
The stirring should dissolve the clumps. If not, you can remove them.
Thanks! What's next?
Have you added the vanilla yet?
evidence: Turn off the heat and stir in the vanilla.

conversation.text: Yes, you have told me that.
Next, chill the tapioca pudding for three hours. You can pour it into 6 individual ramekins, or into a single bowl. Refrigerating will help it set up completely.
evidence: Chill the tapioca pudding for three hours

conversation.text: What should I do after I get the cold pudding?
Serve the pudding or keep it for up to three days.
evidence: Serve the tapioca or store it for up to three day

conversation.text: Alright, I just jotted down what you said. Thanks!
No problem! Lastly, consider topping the pudding with sliced fresh fruit or coconut chips.
evidence: Consider topping the coconut milk tapioca with sliced fresh fruit (such as mango) or coconut chips.

conversation.text: Okay I will.
Congratulations! You have successfully completed this cooking task.

recipe.title: How to Make Coconut Milk Tapioca

procedure.summary: Soak the tapioca in the coconut milk.
procedure.description: Pour 2⅔ cups (630 ml) of coconut milk into a medium saucepan. Stir in  ⅓ cup (50 g) of small pearl tapioca and let it rest for 30 minutes. The tapioca should absorb some of the coconut milk and soften a little.

procedure.summary: Stir in the sugar and salt.
procedure.description: Pour ⅓ cup (65 g) of granulated sugar and ¼ teaspoon (1 g) of salt into the saucepan. Stir the tapioca mixture until the sugar is combined.

procedure.summary: Stir and cook the pudding until it simmers.
procedure.description: Turn the heat to medium and cook the pudding until it begins to bubble gently. Stir the pudding frequently so it doesn't scorch on the bottom. It may take about 10 minutes for the tapioca pudding to start bubbling.

procedure.summary: Reduce the heat and simmer the pudding for 15 minutes.
procedure.description: Turn the heat down to low and stir the pudding constantly. Keep cooking the tapioca pudding for 15 minutes. It should thicken and the tapioca pearls should turn clear.

procedure.summary: Turn off the heat and stir in the vanilla.
procedure.description: Once the tapioca pudding is thick, turn off the heat. Stir in ½ teaspoon (2 ml) of pure vanilla extract until it's thoroughly mixed in.

procedure.summary: Chill the tapioca pudding for three hours.
procedure.description: If you'd like to serve the tapioca pudding in individual bowls, pour the pudding into six ramekins. Place the ramekins (or the entire bowl, if you don't want single servings) into the refrigerator. Chill the puddings for at least three hours. Serve the tapioca or store it for up to three days. Refrigerating the tapioca will help it set up completely. Consider topping the coconut milk tapioca with sliced fresh fruit (such as mango) or coconut chips.
